text: Noe uklar lys brun farge med masse luftig hvitt skum. Lukter av grape og litt ananas. Fruktig og lett søtlig i smak. Noe bitter i ettersmak.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Lekkie, doskonale pijalne, orzeźwiające.

From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours clear, golden with limited fine white foam. Aroma is weird: similar to a bretted beer, with hay, some cereal, some citrus. Body is medium. Taste is bitter, with some acidity maybe. Finish is long in bitterness.

Gravity Cask Third of a Pint at GBBF 2015, Olympia, London Aug 2015 - Clear Yellow in colour. Average white frothy head. Fruity; grapefruit citrus. Hoppy; grassy hops. Malty; biscuity malts. Easy drinking. Moderately bitter citrus fruity hoppy throughout. Very tasty for low ABV. Decent. (2015-08-15)

330ml bottle, and cold. Pale yellow with small fine white head which disappeared quite quickly. Smells hoppy, and tastes very hoppy. Citrus aftertaste. I like it. I see it is also available on tap: Id like to try that!
33cl bottle from beermerchants. Hazy gold color. Thin white head. Taste is medium high bitter, light sweetness. Thin dry body. Aroma is hops, herbs, pine, citric, pinneapple.
Pours clear yellow with a medium head. Aroma is lemon and sherbet. Bit of a lemony taste with a kind of homebrew aftertaste. Itll do but Ill not seek out.
Bottle from beer52. Thin head on pouring, a hazy straw colour. A little metallic touch to the after taste. Moderate level of hops, a decent table pale ale but nothing special.
Bottle at home. Aroma is crisp fruity hops, grass, citrus, grapefruit. Flavour is lightly sweet and medium bitter. Body is light to medium. Very nice crisp hoppy refreshing session ale.

33cl bottle at home from FirmaBier. Nose is fresh fruity, malty. Body is clear pale, head is big, white, rocky, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is malty, citric, grapefruit. Light sweet, medium bitter, light citric sour. Finish is long lasting hoppy medium bitter, hint of salt. Light body, dry texture, average carbonation. Easy, refreshing hoppy beer, simple but tasty, nice one.

330ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours clearly carbonated clear bright gold with a foamy white head. Hoppy aroma, somewhat floral, some orange peel. Flavor is similar, sweet up front, a little hoppy bitterness throughout.

Bottle. Golden beer with a strong frothy head. The aroma is hopped with a dry yeasty feel, and the flavour is very bitter and hopped with a yeasty finish. Overall a nice well hopped pale ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bevuta alla spina e in bottiglia da 33cl. Il colore è giallo doratocarico, pulita, limpida, con una bella schiuma bianca, fine e persistente. Al naso sentori di erbaceo, di fieno, e fruttato, ananas. Al palato corpo leggero, con un leggero miele millefiori. Finale piacevolmente secco.
Da bere bere bere...

Draft 0.15l at In De Wildeman Amsterdam Netherlands.07.04.2016.Pour it hazy golden color wtih small white head.Aroma eggy,kind of sulfur,annoying.Taste starts with herbal funky,kind of dry at the end,smooth finish with lemon flavor,fizzy carbonation,medium body,after taste grassy and grainy.

Sampled from tap at In de Wildeman. Clear, golden yellow with a white head. Fruity-grassy aroma of lemon peel, grapefruit and pomelo. Slightly bitter, grassy-fruity taste of lemon peel, grapefruit and pomelo, followed by a short, slightly grassy-bitter finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Okay.
Aroma is super grassy, almost like urine. Clear, light golden. Taste is somewhat bitter and earthy.
Clear yellow, white lacing foam head. Light hoppy aroma, nice bitter taste. Citrus notes, tintling on tongue. (Velp 201604)

It pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is hoppy and grassy with notes of pineapple, apple and citrus with some light grains. Tate is pineapple, citrus and grass. Light to medium bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, quite nice

Bottle from Gulating Lørenskog enjoyed at home
Golden hazy, massive white head. Smell of citrus, grapefruti, pine, sap and light malts. Moderate sweet, tropical fruits and citrus flavors, resins, hints of soap, distinct hop presence. Heavy bitter, resin tail. Very nice stuff
How : bottle Appearance : almost clear light golden, large white head. Aroma : orange peel, herbs, floral, grapefruit and fresh yeast. Palate : light body, average carbonation.

Torno dopo una cena da amici calabresi, che mi avevano dato di tutto; entro in casa apro il frigo e trovo questa. Devo bere per digerire, e in effetti la top fa bene la sua missione in questo caso, però non mi ha convinto del tutto...
bottle. Hazy golden with thin white head. Fresh hoppy aroma, Sweet malty flavour with light hoppy finish

Golden clear with proper white head. Aroma have some citrus, malt, grass, very little fruits. Flavour is quite IPAish, a lot of hops. Some strong notes of grapefruit, lemon as well. After rather bitter. Refreshing and very enjoyable!

Hazy golden with a large white, nearly solid, head. Nose is grapefruit and hops. Taste is straight bitter, very IPAish for a golden ale. Grapefruit and strong Chinook hops all over the place. Bitter, refreshing and very smooth. Very enjoyable beer.
Bottle from M&S, Walsall. Pale golden beer with small head and lots of spritz. Aroma is grapefruit, lemon and yeast. Taste is citrus lemon, orange pith, grapefruit and zesty. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: KRS 080815. Golden-yellow colour with an off-white head. Aroma is malt, hop, citrus, fruit. Flavour is malt, hop, citrus, fruit, floral, grass. Medium body. Ordinary beer.
33cl bottle. Hazy golden with an average frothy head. Loads of fruity hops, grassy, light biscuit. Bitter finish. Some mild sweetness and a big body for this abv make it very round. A winner.
Gulbrun noe tåkete med høyt hvitt skum. Lukter syrlige epler. Også syrlig i smak, men noe fruktsødme er der også. Lett medium lang avslutning.

330ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy light yellow with pillowy white head. Aroma is citrus, slightly tart hops, grass and sherbet lemon. Lovely delicate citrus taste. Oranges, lemons and other fruits - mangoes and melon. Dry hoppy finish.

Tasty little fresh devil at only 3,6%!Clear golden stuff with a huge white head that last a long time. Quite floral and grapefruithoppy aroma. Niiiiice! Medium (light) body and a fine fresh carbonation. Grapefruit hoppy, floral and some pine. Lasting flavor![Bottle from Gulating in Arendal, Norway]

Yellow colored, strong soapy white lasting head. Aroma is malty, grains, citrus, herbal and floral hops. Taste is low to medium sweet malt, quite grainy, medium to strong citrus, herbal and floral hoppy bitterness. Lasting bitter aftertaste. Light bodied, moderate to low carbonation. Nice, easy and refreshing.

Aroma molto deciso, presente, porta un bel po di arancia, anche del pompelmo, magari una suggestione tropicale che ricorda lananas, e lerba appena tagliata. Buona lintensità, anche una discreta pulizia. In bocca sembra di ritrovare una arancia sia liquida che croccante, che si accompagna ad un leggerissimo imbocco di caramello e toffee, prima di una sferzata decisa che vira sullamore vegetale. Ritorna un po di pepe nel retrogusto.

15.09.2015, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Big slightly fizzy-creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry floral, weeds, hay, leafs, flowers, moss, light malts, hops, minerals, bark. Taste is dry and harsh, bark, weeds, hay, hops, grass, light malts, minerals, medicine. Longlasting bitterness, harsh mouthfeel. Not really my cup of tea...

33cl bottle from Marks & Spencer, Camberley. Pale straw with a tight white head; citrus aroma with some pine resin thrown in for good measure; a big grapefruit taste; and a crisp clean grapefruit finish. Lots of flavour at a low ABV.
Bottle. Yellow and slightly hazy. Hoppy with a bitter finish. An amazing amount of flavour and body considering its low strength. Nearly put this one back on the shelf-so glad I did not.

Cask at GBBF 2015. Clear gold, oily, a bit of bubbles. Grassy, pissy hop nose, NZ I would guess, grapefruit, light malt. Very hoppy flavor, Kiwi all the way. Grapefruit rind and pith, cat piss, astringent herbs and leaves. Interesting. Light honeyed malts in the back. Long, burning hop finish. A bit too much like hop tea, really, but nice.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of citrus, some floral notes, fruitiness and malt. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some pine, floral notes and herbs. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, pine and orange. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long dry, piney and citrus finish, Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Some lacing left as the white head slowly slides down the glass. Lightly hazy pale golden body. Its piney and resiny on the nose, with some citrus peel and a little touch of pale malts. Theres a nice bitterness in the flavor, with a little malty touch in the back. Resins, pine cones and citrus zest. Medium body and a nice carbonation. Lasting dry and bitter finish. Very easy drinkable and tasteful this one, sure quenches the thirst. 150808
Bottle. Aromas citrus and pine, a bit of grapefruit. Taste is a little fruit with a long bitter finish. Ok.

Bottle. Really surprised Id not rated this. Nose is lemon, lime, light grapefruit hint of lychee. Taste is resin grapefruit rind slight floral perfume hop note in the bitter finish. 

The mouthfeel is a little thin but that is a product of the low abv. 

The drink is too thin but has a fantastic amount of taste for the abv.
Bottle at home from Marks and Spencer cloudy golden ale with pine citrus aroma flavour is citrus pine and grapefruit lingering bitter finish light refreshing beer
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2015 330ml bottle from brewery via Eebria. Golden colour, white head. Aroma citrus and pine. Taste mid bitter with a bitter finish.
Aromas of pine and grapefruit, slightly onion. Taste is piney, grapefruit, slightly metallic. A touch watery but easy drinking

In bottiglia da 33cl. Colore giallo dorato, piuttosto limpida, schiuma bianca, fine e abb persistente. Aroma di fieno, erba appena tagliata, resinoso poi in secondo piano del fruttato, ananas. Al palato corpo watery, scorre veloce con un leggero miele millefiori seguito da un taglio erbaceo, secco, resinoso e appena fruttato.
Cask at Euston Tap, London. Clear golden, small white head. Grainy malt aroma, floral, herbal and citrucy hops. Light to medium bodied, low to medium carbonation. Dry with high bitterness.

Great low ABV pale ale. Tropical fruit aroma giving way to a sharp grapefruit bitter finish. While the low ABV would suggest a sessionable beer, the intense bitterness will strip your palate bare after too many. Sounds like a challenge to me!

[National Winter Ales Festival, Derby, 2015] - Buxton Brewery Moor Top, Golden klar, 3.6%, florales Aroma, trocken, Im Antrunk sehr viel Floralität, hopfige Bitterkeit. Zur Mitte sehr bitter, sehr hopfig, im Ausklang hopfig und bitter, aber auch sehr flach. Bitterkeit hält aber extrem lange an.

On tap @ In De Wildeman, sample size glass. Clear, straw blonde/pale yellow color. White head. Aromas: malty sweet, grain/malt, refreshing fruit, citrus/tropical fruits. Sweetish, grainish and hop-aromatic retronasal. Flavor: rather bitter, almost acidic. Light bodied, but not too thin. Long bitter finish. Nice!

Létiquette donnait des indices de Stout et pourtant onn peut lire Pale Ale tout en bas et cest bien de ça dont il sagit. Bière franche à lamertume sincère et dune simplicité élégante. Jaime vraiment bien Buxton.
UPDATED: JUN 25, 2015 Prima biertje. Zachte ale met een wat bittere nasmaak en zeker geen hoogvlieger.
Draught, Holy Etruria. Pale yellow body. Thin white head. Clean and crisp, quite dry. A bit thin, but pleasant enough. Not Buxtons best.
Bottle. Pours clear golden colour, with a great bitter taste.The best Golden Ale I tasted

Bottle from Marks And Spencer (!) Pours cloudy and golden. Great aroma. Lots of citrusy hops. Very resinous. Bit of tropical fruit. Lovely creamy, carbonation. Taste is tangy citrus. Bit of mango. Very bitter. Maybe a tad too much for me here but impressive none-the-less. Long lasting, mouth coating finish. Great body despite the low abv. Awesome pale ale!

330ml bottle, pours hazy peach gold with a small white head. Punchy citrus aroma, notes of apricot and peach, straw and biscuity malt. Light bodied with a thin texture. Finish is long and bitter, and then some. Good flavourable session beer.
pours clear pale golden. Aroma: fruit, citrus, spruce. Taste: medium bitterness, lightly sour, spruce, citrus. Palate: light body, thin feel, long bitter finish,

Cask at The Buxton Brewery Tap House. A clear pale golden colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is hoppy of citrusy apple and grape plus grassy, herbal hops, also some smokiness. Taste of dry grapefruit, grape, also orange, grassy, herbal hops and slight biscuit. Light bodied but a watery texture. A dry, grapefruit bitterness in the finish. Smelled promising, but dry, bitter, thin and quite astringent after a while

(Buxton Moor Top) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 3.6%
Mostly clear body, golden yellow in colour, with two fingers of thick, white head sitting on top. Aroma has citrusy hops, floral notes.
Taste of malts, grass, citrus, a bit of pine, some tropical fruits on the finish. Quite bitter, nice.
Medium thin body, nicely carbonated.
Tasty, sessionable beer.

330 ml from Beer-shop.gr, Athens Greece. Golden yellow color, clear, with a thin white head. Nose is mildly sweet with malts and grains. Taste is malty and floral, with some herbal notes. Like a pilsner with some hops. Aftertaste is light and mildly bittersweet. Light body with low carbonation. Not a good Buxton beer.

Pint on tap at Euston Tap. Unusual nose, sweet malt plus ?. Flat golden beer with thin lasting head. Strong chalky bitter taste followed by even more bitterness. Finish is piney and........bitter. Nice.

33cl bottle from SIP veini- ja õllepood, Tallinn. Pours clear golden with a moderate and bubbely white head. Fruity aroma dominated by citrus with notes of sour berries, pale malt and hints of herbs. Moderate sweet and quite flavourful for a low ABV beer. Finishes with a nice bitterness. Tasty and sessionable.

Bottle @ De Tolly, Tartu.
Very interesting aroma and taste. Hoppy with grapefruit notes. Best golden ale I tasted so far.
Bottle conditioned. Pours a dark orange colour with a thin white head, aroma is all citrus, taste is bitter with citrus fruits with a dry fruity finish.
Bottle - super pale yellow with a small bubbly crisp white head. aroma of bubblegum, apple, wheat and hay. Taste of malts, hay, a little caramel and some dust. Light body, medium carbonation.
Sorprendentemente sabrosa para sus tres grados, ligera y seca, refrescante en su amargor limpio y herbal.
Very classic golden colour. Nose is nice with herbal hints. Taste is good for a simple pale ale. Very light and refreshing but nothing great Im afraid.
Quite a simple one. Some hay with a touch of grass and spruce. Non-spectacular piwo with decent drinkability. Nothing adorable about that one.

Bottle. The beer has got a light hazy yellow colour with an airy head and medium body. Aroma of bitterness and hops. Taste of bitter hops, spruce, bread, flowers. Dry-bitter and floral finish. Had higher expectations.
Feels bit like mold blackcurrant jam. Some malty background bit fruitiness. Light sweetness, moderate bitterness. Drinkable, but bit weird.
Aroma upeņu zapte, gara- sapelejusi upeņu sapte. Dzert var, bet 2x nepirktu. Knibina melē :D

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2015 Clear gold, medium white head. Strong hoppy nose, hints of pineapple and apple. Medium thick body, with a powerful yet balanced bitterness, some sweet-ish notes, and a lot of fruitiness. Finishes with a wee bitter finish. Very very nice.

0,33 pullo@ Vihreä Haltiatar. Sameahko kullankeltainen. Haisee oksennukselta. Hyvin tunkkainen hedelmä oksennuksen takaa havaittavissa. Maussa hiukan hedelmää, todella karvasta mäntysuopaa ja selvästi oksennusta.

.33l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours cloudy yellow with medium head. Aroma is vomit, hops pinesoap and malts. Flavor is mostly same but less vomity. Nice body for this ABV.

Mostly bittering hops in the aroma without much fresh flavor - though that could well be from the voyage over the pond. Hazy light orange pour with ok head and lacing. Soft carbonation. Some grassy notes. Medium bitter finish. Tap at Churchkey.
Cask @ Cask, Manchester. Clear pale gold pale ale with a small creamy head. Has a light dry hoppy character with a very small fruitiness. Nose includes some malts.

On tap @ Kælderkoldt. This is a soft blurry almost pale straw golden one. It has a nice big white dense head with great retention. It smells really mild but nice. Soft grassy, a mild caramel sweetness. A little cornish hint also detected. Actually not that bad, perhaps a tad dull. Really lightdrinkable and surprisingly tasty. Not a huge flavor bomb but its gentle, elegant and somewhat refined in the taste. Some bitter orange peel with hints of straws and thin caramel. Really lightdrinkable as I might have mentioned before in this rating? 09.08.2014

floral, pale, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, 
got a couple of bottles from beerparlour its a nice drink and from my home county could do with being stronger but hey its still very nice

Backlog rating. 33cl bottle in London. It pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is hoppy and grassy with notes of pineapple, apple and citrus with some light grains. Tate is pineapple, citrus and grass. Light to medium bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, quite nice

From tap at BierCab, Barcelona. Clear pale yellow color with white head. Aroma is malty, bready and straw, hoppy, grassy floral and herbal. Taste is sweet and bitter, Light almost thin body with average carbonation.
Cask@ pivini York. Light yellow. Slight haze. Fine one finger. Citrus. Fine bitter mouthfeel. Super fresh. Delicious.

At Macche (Rome/Italy) pump draught. Pours pale yellow, hazy with an enormous white head. Nose: citrus, light malts. Mouth is basically lemon, sweet notes and bitter end. Nice one to consume a lot. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en tienda XXXII. Color dorado claro. Sabor a malta, lupulo, resinoso, suave, ligeramente afrutado.

Bottle from Tallinna Kaubamaja ( 3,00) in Oct 2014. Bottled in Apr 2014. Pours a translucent pale orange with a white top (retains and laces nicely). The aroma is juicy, piney and grapefruity bittersweet. The one Im having lacks freshness due to the bottling date, and has acquired a not pleasant pungent note - I remember it being better the other times Ive had it. Taste is at first modestly sweet, then the nice hop bitterness takes over, leaving a lingering grapefruit seed finish. Excellent balance between bitter and sweet. Body light to medium (not at all watery), carbonation soft. For a mere 3,6% this beer is impressive - its definitely among my favourite lighter pale ales we have around here. Love it!
Bottle@ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours clear golden with small white head. Aroma is fruity, lemon and honey. Taste is medium bitter, grapefruit,malty. Medium body. Good beer.

330ml bottle from The Beerhive.
Big frothy white nose settles quickly, a little lacing. Hazy golden body. Sweet nose, honey and lemon. Flavour is sweet fruit, more honey, bitter grapefruit finish. Good lingering bitterness on the aftertaste. Mouthfeel is good, medium carbonation and good bit of body, fills the mouth well. Really well balanced and easy to drink. Tons of flavour and low abv, a superb session beer.

Bottle from Eebria. Very pale golden yellow, translucent, slightly sparkling, small ring of white head. Aroma is very light jasmine, slight metal. Body is light, pretty spritzy, slightly foamy. Taste is malty, lager-like, enduring saaz-ish bitterness is quite nice, but its not living up to the bill as an APA. Too watery. Very average.
On tap at Biercab. Golden colour with white head. Fruity, herbal and earthy aroma. Fruity, herbal, resinous and bitter taste, very hoppy. Light body.

Bottle 33cl (brown label). Clear pale golden color, small foamy white head, stays for a while, fair lacing; strong citrus nose, grapefruit, lemon; fresh bitttersweet taste (more bitter than sweet); light to medium body, never watery, soft carbonation; crisp light bitter finish. Good balance, you dont notice the low ABV. Really good.

Bottle shared thanks to Jmgreenuk. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus with big grape notes. Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Really good for the ABV.
Poured a hazy light amber with an off white head. Aroma of moderately sweet citrus and soft malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter.
Pineapple and grape fruit and a fizzy dirty base. Sandy colour with a small head and low carbonation. Nice beer.
Keg in Tapped Leeds. Straw coloured with a little white head. Good, bitter and citrusy. A very good beer for the ABV.

Cask @Greyfriar. Pale, clear, gold. Piney. In a lavatory block sense, but not really unpleasantly. Bit thin, bitterness that lingers, then departs. I would order it again, but not here, today, when Sound Wave is available.
Nice blonde beer with a bit of hoppy citrous flavor. Easy drinking. Easy to drink it again and again :-)

330mL bottle. Pours a light straw, medium to small white head, no lacing. Aroma of citrus hops, some hay, caramel malt, a little thin on the nose. Taste is citrus upfront, tropical fruit, caramel, some yeast, cheese, finish is soft.

21/VI/14 - 33cl bottle @ Le Trappiste (Brugge) - Bieruitstap met de Gentse Biervereniging - bottled: 23/I/14 (2014-652) 
Clear pale blond beer, small whtie head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, some melon, cheesy, bit metallic, very fruity, passion fruits. MF: soft to no carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty bitter, bit fruity, cheesy hops, some melon again, hoppy, bit grassy, very English. Aftertaste: bitter, grassy hops, bit yeasty, cheesy, very dry, some citrus. Very enjoyable!

33cl bottled on 15/04/14. Very pale yellow, minimal white head that disappears almost immediately. Smells of sweet and tropical fruits. Taste is malts and some tropical fruits again with a good dry bitter finish. Very tasteful for a 3.6 ABV beer.
330ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique. Rating from 2013. Light in the mouth with a faint hint of citrus.

330ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, yellow-ish golden colour with small, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Citrusy, hoppy aroma, hints of lemon, lime and grapefruit, a herbal touch, biscuity malty basis. Taste is citrusy hoppy, hints of lemon, lime, a herbal touch, some gooseberry, biscuity malty basis, a mineral touch. Nice, refreshing, very drinkable; extremely flavourful for its low abv.

Pale lemon yellow, slightly hazy. Thin head quickly fades but doesnt entirely disappear. Aromas faint tropical fruit and cereal. Taste moderate sweet, bitter and sour. Finish quite bitter. For the gravity excellent.

On tap at Buxton Tap House, pours a hazy yellow with a small white head. Nose brings out lots of hay and biscuity malts. Flavour brings out dry floral hops, some hay, and biscuity malt. Quite dry and astringent, with a nice floral component. Very well-balanced, with a slight farmhouse character. Very nice.

330 ml bottle from Birra+ (bottled on 15-04-2014). Pale canary yellow, slightly hazy, with a tiny, non persistent white head. Tropical explosion on the nose: papaya, mango, lots of pineapple, some light melon/white grapes notes, very fruity and hop forward, but in a different way. Some mild earthy presence, almost like wet tea leaves or wood smell. Surprisingly flavourful for such a low ABV beer. Quite high level of bitterness, definitely a solid bready/biscuity malt presence. Fruity, slightly peppery and hoppy as well, but more citrusy than tropical. It feels watery, but it really isnt. Extremely drinkable tho. Average carbonation, light body, slightly creamy texture. Another great one from Buxton.

A woody (oak), nutty cask ale with plenty of spicy hops to keep you interested. On the dry side with some lemons in the finish.

Rated by BrewTom
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Nothing crazy about this but a tasty citric pale that goes down damn easy. Bottle was gone in 30 seconds. Super lemony with plenty of straw and zest. Nice

(draught) pours a slightly hazy pale golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy cactus juice, tamatos, nettles, pepper and a hint of yeast. flavour is mostly talcum powder, ginger and yeast, with a light sweetness and a herbal-hoppy finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle from redmonds. Pours cloudy lemon with little or no head. Bread, citrus, floral aroma. Sweet dry biscuit flavour with mild bitterness. High carbonation. Light body and slight watery finish. Light refreshing session beer. Another nice one.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch bitter hopfig, fruchtig. Geschmack fruchtig hopfig, bitter, trocken, würzig.

On tap at Birratrovo in Como.
Good and hoppy beer. Very drinkable.
More tastefull than I expected
Keg at the hanging bat. A little cheesy, dry bitter, light pineapple, a bit like juice, bit too cold.
Cask in the Macc, Macclesfield. Pale almost clear gold with a medium white head. This is a hard style to excite me and this pretty much did. Drinkable. Can throw away a few. Nice session ale.
Golden with white head. Aroma and taste: a lot of hops with citrus flavour. Soft and easy to drink. Good.

330 ml bottle from Redmonds. Pale, cloudy straw yellow, frothy white head. Delicate floral and perfume hops in the aroma, some citrus and lemon zest notes too. Light pale malt flavour followed by a decent bitter bite, grapefruit. Some biscuit notes toward the finish. Quite dry, fairly fizzy too. Lots of flavour for such low ABV, a very good sessioner.

Butelka 0.33L. Słomkowe, jasnozłote, opalizujące (wlałem odrobinę drożdży). Piana średnioobfita, biała, drobno- i średniopęcherzykowa.
Aromat: porzeczka, cytryna, ananas, średniointesywnie.
Smak: chmielowo-cytrusowo, cytryna, albedo cytryny, grejpfrut, biszkopt.
Goryczka średnia-.
Piwo lekko kwaskowe, wytrawne, orzeźwiające. Wodniste, średniowysycone. odczucie w ustach kremowo-pudrowe.
Przyjemne, lekkie orzeźwiające, bardzo pijalne APA.
Cask west riding dewsbury. Yellow colour ok white head lacing. Aroma is citrus peel. Taste is sweet malts followed by bitter citrus grapefruit hops medium bitter finish. Medium body. Ok stuff

W aromacie przeważają wyraźne, trawiaste nuty od chmielu, jest świeżo i orzeźwiająco. W smaku czuć mocną goryczkę o lekko pestkowym charakterze i długim finiszu z lekkim winogronowym posmakiem, brak obecności treści słodowej (całkowicie przytłumiona przez goryczkę), co nie kłóci się z dobrą pijalnością i gładkością piwa (największy jego atut). Fajne.
Smell of soap andcitrus. Citrus colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, spruce, hops. Flat carbon. Quite basic IPA.

Bottled @ de Molen tasting, small sample. Almost clear yellow color, short head. Aroma is a bit grassy and flowery hop, some grainy malt. Probably not the freshest example and it clearly has hurt the beer. Bit watery in taste, some bitterness. Bit watery stuff for now. Probably was a lot better from bottle and even better than that from cask.
Clear blond appearance. Aroma of pale malts and a touch of soap. Very fresh but light tasting. The balance is good. Light carbonation but quite a creamy feel.

Bottle at the March 2014 De Molen monthly tasting. Poured a crystal clear light amber with a frothy white head and some broken lace. The aroma is lime citrus. The flavour is light sweet, very light bitter with a light, watery malt hop citrus palate. Medium to light bodied with soft carbonation. Smelled great but the enjoyment rapid faded.

Sample at the Molen monthly tasting.
thick creamy white head. Clear golden pour. Nice bitterness.
bottle from saveur-biere. Hazy golden colour, mid-sized white head. Aroma of roses and tropcial fruit. Light-bodies, shy malty base yet it transports the intensive aromatic hope very well.

Bottle shared with a friend at home. Color: pale blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: herbal and floral notes with hops and malt good balance. Taste: nice malt and hops balance, really drinkable and fresh. Aftertaste: nice small bitterness.

Flaske 0,5l fra Kilpishalli. Drukket hjemme 9 Apr 13. Lys gylden. Uklar. Høyt luftig skum som varer lenge. Mye lacing. Pent! Herlig ferskenaroma. Smaken det samme med tillegg av ulike frukter. Blir litt tørr etter hvert. Innholdsrik. Litt bunnfall. Verdensrekord i smak/% ?

Pale golden colour with a frothy white head with good lasting and nice lacework. Aroma is citrusy with some pine notes, slighty malty. Flavor has a decent bitterness with a good presence of citrus notes, some grapefruit as well, light maltiness. The final has a good bitterness with a dry mouthfeel.

(Bottle): Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of citrus, floral, bread, pale malt. Flavour is much of the same with a slight orange and peach hint on the finish. Moderately bitter and overall the beer is a little subdued.
Cask at the York Tap. Very pale yellow pour, thin white head. Very floral aromas, some yeastiness too. Slips down like water. Would like a bit more character to it.

Aroma: medium floral hops, some bread malts. Appearance: hazy pale gold, medium frothy head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: low carbonation, bitters continue. Overall: quite bitter for a Golden Ale, but nice and very drinkable anyway. Bottle from Drinkers Paradise, London.

Small bottle. Cloudy yellow body, medium head. Citric hops in the aroma but quite weak. Taste has unassertive lemony hops and some wheat. Decent hoppy finish but with a low ABV like this the beers flavour balance and overall impression suffers.

33cl bottle from Stockbridge Tap.
Appearance - very pale, almost white. Definitely lighter than golden. Some head. 
Nose - yoghurty, the yeast is dominant. Maybe some lemon, not really any fruit though not unpleasant.
Taste - more lemon yoghurt with a hint of pale malt. 
Palate - very light bodied, and texture is similar and the finish is dry. 
Overall - a good effort to make a beer under 4% that has some taste, thought his is still very much yeast dominated. Ill reach for a Jarl or an Orkney Best before this.

Bottled: 10.2013. Pours hazy straw-golden with small white head; the head stays for some time. Aroma: fresh citrus, grass, mango, vinegar. Taste: a lot of grapefruit, fresh fruits, mango, with some sweetness and watery taste in the background. Long grapefruit bitter finish. Overall: its very fruity, almost citrus beer. It hides watery notes rather well (3,6% usually means that watery tastes will dominate). OK beer, but not among my favorites.
330ml bottle. Hazy, light brown color. Small size, white head, stays. Sour, dirty cloth, malty, grainy, bit dead aroma. Malty, hops, grainy taste. Sneaking bitterness in aftertaste. Slick mouthfeel.
Cloudy yellowish colour with a disappointing white head. Strong floral aroma. Decent bitter taste too.

Cask by handpump at Bon Accord, Glasgow - clear golden yellow, thin off-white head, grapefruit citrusy aroma, intermittent lacing, sharp citrus, grapefruit flavour, bit of earthy malt, flavoursome, dry hoppy finish

50cl 3,6% bottle picked up from K Kilpishalli Finland.
Tall white head, golden almost clear body. Lots of hops to the nose, grapefruit, pine needles. Distinct british bitter style of taste. Fruity hops all the way, well weighted towards the bitter signature, accompanied by the grapefruit feel. Very refreshing. Ends with a dry bitter twist, roasted malts, ash, a little bread. Very well done out of such a moderate abv.
On draft at Pizzeria Paradisio in Old Town VA. Pours a clear pale gold with an off white head. Feint malt nose. Flavors of biscuit. Light bodied. Moderate carbonation. Bitter finish.

Cask at The Harp. Pour a clear gold colour with a thin head. Aroma is a bit sweaty and funky. Lightly body, a bit watery. Mild carbonation. White bread and grapefruit hoppiness in the main. OK. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Proper see straight through it pale not really amber pour. Citrus. Grapefruit. Gentle bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2015 Bottle from Cornelius. Hazy pale golden body with a medium white head. Great lacing. Aroma of lemon sherbert, peach and grapefruit. Flavour of citrus, herbs, biscuit and a slight metallic tang. Not a million miles away from the citrussy brilliance of Buxtons (also excellent) Spa. Thin to medium body with a watery, slightly oily texture. Soft carbonation. Sharp and sessionable. A lovely Golden Ale - much better than on cask.
 
Cask from Cloisters (August 2013). Clear pale golden body with a thin white head that fades. Light lacing marks. Almost no aroma - grass, straw and lime. The flavour is very subtle - soft citrus and straw. No bitterness on the finish. Thin body with an oily texture and very soft carbonation. A lovely low-ABV Golden Ale, but not the most interesting or complex. (Rated: 3.2.)

August 24, 2013 - hand-pull cask at The Craft Beer Co (Clerkenwell). Mostly clear pale gold with a smallish lasting rocky white head. Lovely aroma - pungently catty, nice and bitter but not overwhelming. Taste - wow, even more one-dimensional - what minimal grainy malt the aroma promised is even more minimal - mostly just pungent catty bitterness. Light body, astringent, light carbonation and a long pungent drying bitter finish - I love it, but its a bit aggressive.

0.5L bottle, 3.6%. Clear light gold color with a white head. Fruity smell and taste of citrus, grapefruit. Taste is dominated by the classic pale ale bitternes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Trader, Cannon Street, London - Gold pour medium white head. Hoppy grassy in both taste and aroma. Some herbal,floral nuances. Ok.

On cask at Royal Oak, Hurdlow - A clear gold body, thick lasting white head. Loads of hop nose, the citrus kind, lots of grapefruit and tropical notes that give a great idea of what is to come Good creamy palate, with a good sour hit of citrus fruit. Quality, and only 3.6%? A great night ahead!!!!
Cask at the Pelt Trader, Cannon St. Bright yellow pour with a white head. Grassy hop aroma with light malts and vanilla. Fresh herb taste. Some citrus in there. Bitter hop finish. Interesting.

Small white head. Hazy pale yellow body. Light floral peachy grain aroma with gooseberry notes. Dry-sweet wooden floral peach taste with resiny dusty notes. Mild, flat, soft mouthfeel. Mid-bodied. Dry floral dusty wooden aftertaste with resiny dandelion notes. Long, lingering, bitter finish. Vivid and full of flavour, possibly a bit too bitter at the end. (0.284l cask at Pivni, York.)

Bottle. Hazy gold with a white foam. Aromas are grassy with hay and some floral, soapy notes. Apricot, lemon and pineapple with peppery pine. Grapefruit with woody aspects. Flavours are sweet tropical fruit with bitter, pithy grapefruit and green pine. Juicy fruit with a solid bitterness. Very tasty for its strength.
Draft. Hazy pale yellow color, large bubble whitebhead. Aroma and taste are subtle and smooth. Easy drinking session beer.
Cask at Sheffield Tap. End of the barrel. Cloudy and a bit flat. Still good though, which says a lot. Grapefruit, and lots of it.

Cask (Bow Bar, Edinburgh) Golden with.a small white head. Gooseberries, tea and lemon in the aroma. Hoppy taste with lemin, grapefruit ad gooseberries standing out. Plenty if flavour for the strength.

Bottle. Low fluffy white lasting head. Hazy yellow body. Mild malty fruity aroma and flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness and notes of grapefruite. Low carbonation. Long bitter finish. Better than expected.

Pours a clear gold with a small white head and lively carbonation. Plenty of citrus - grapefruit, lemon, orange - in the nose as well as some tropical fruit (passionfruit maybe). Taste is much the same with citrus dominating. Good bitterness in the mid-palate. Quite a clean finish with a light fruity aftertaste. Very nice pale ale.

Bottle from cotteridge wines. Perfect example of a light session ale packed full of flavour and attitude. Soft golden ale with lovely citrus fruits and well balanced bitterness. Could drink this all day. Buxton showing how its done again.
Cask at Kittys, Helsinki. Originally rated 26072012. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, hops and malts.

500mL bottle. Pours light clear golden/straw with a very small white head and a nice biscuit/fruity/doughy aroma. It has a complex flavour with hints of doughy yeast, an abundance of sweet fruity/citrus hops, and a light backing of biscuit like malt. This beer impressed me. I would love to try it fresh (BB jan 2014).

Tap @ MikkellerBar, Stefansgade. Clear golden with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, little citrus and a little grass. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, grass, straw, hop, little sweet, little grapefruit and medium bitter.
Draught at Mikkeller&Friends. Clear yellow - white head. Light malty. Hay. Straw. Herbal. Grassy. Ok fresh hoppy. Ok.

11/05/2013 Ma che siete venuti a fà (cask). Bionda, limpida, schiuma bianca molto abbondante e persistente. Al naso sentori fruttati e floreali, con sentori agrumati, leggere note di malto. In bocca è amara decisa, forse non proprio il cocktail di luppoli che preferisco, ma indiscutibilmente buona. Corpo leggero, carbonazione soft. Discreta.

Bottle. Aroma of lime, white grapes, ripe pear, pineapple and subtle resin. Assertively hopped, yet not overhopped. Light body, crisp hoppy taste, strong bitterness. Flavour is fruity hoppy upfront, while grassy, herbaceously hoppy in the finish. Remarkable that it gets even better when it warms up a bit. A great everyday beer.
Bottle. Hazy yellow, slightly greenish color with no head. Aroma of lemon, floral hops and grapefruit. Flavors are grapefruit and kitchen cleaner. Medium bitter taste.

Cask (gravity) @ The 18th Reading Beer and Cider Festival 2012, Reading, Berkshire England.Clear matt medium yellow colour with a average, open and frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, toasted, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, cat piss. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20120504]

Bottle @ Y.N.W.A Beershop. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Nose is fresh grass and citrus. Flavor adds a bit of mamelade and grapefruit. Really smooth, soft, and crisp. Bitter lasting end. Delicious!

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 On cask at The Holy Inadequate, Etruria. Pours golden with white head. Extremely zesty and well hopped golden ale. Very flavoursome with such a low ABV--- 04/05/2015 Old Bulls Head, Newcastle under Lyme.
50cl bottle. Pale yelow colour, no head. Pine, resin aroma. Soft carbonation, almost flat. Average bitter aftertaste.

27.03.2013. 0,5l Bottle. Thanks to Gunnar! Golden orange colour with white head. Verys strong lemon aroma and flavour. There is also some strong notes of grapefruit,dry grassy hay or straw and spruce. Very fresh and aromatic combined with rather sharp strong bitterness. Very much hops. Body is medium with moderate carbonation.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; straw yellow pour with white head, zesty hop aroma, decent hop taste bit watery probably due to ABV.

Bottle, bought @ YNWA, Kolding. Pours completely clear, very pale golden with a small, staying, creamy, white head. Aroma is lovely, peach, pine, citrus. Medium carbonation, lovely dry and light mouthfeel. Flavour has good hops, crisp malts. Peach, pine,resin. Very bitter, lingering finish.

Bottle from MyBrewerytap. Pours cloudy straw coloured with a moderate sized creamy snow white head. Aroma of weak citrus hops. Taste is dry, fruity oranges and lemons, resiny bitter dry end. Nice and easy, does it .

Bottle from Birratrovo, Como, bb Aug 2013Blond color, with straw hue; small head. The aroma is mild, with fruity hops, grass and spices. Dry mouthfeel with good malt-toffee flavor, hay, and excellent hopping, very herbaceous, with touch of citrus fruits and spices (pepper); long final.Excellent, very drinkable.

Aroma: citrus marmalade and dough
Appearance: clear orange marmalade
Head: thin marbled ivory; leaves lovely lace effects on glass
Taste: slightly salty, exploding to bitter across whole of tongue
Palate: soft carbonation; light body; thin texture; long bitter finish
Overall: A really fine rich and long-lasting bitter experience, though has not quite got that third dimension for top marks - but highly recommended at the Euston Tap for bargain £3.20 a pint

Clear straw yellow, white frothy head dissipates fast leaving lacing. Aroma is strongly hoppy with grapefruit, juniper. High bitterness has lots lots citrus, balancing fruity sweetness, light body and feel, long bitter dry fruity finish. Light bitterness bomb with long challenging taste, lightness gives this kind of easy-to-drink feel but high hoppiness probably keeps most from from drinking that many. Great for summer and a fish dish.
500ml bottle. Yellow appearance. Well hopped grapefruit taste. A lengthy mouthfeel. Overall: worthy.

Cask (Gallows Bird, Espoo, Fest2013)
Smells like it will be a bit of a watery bitter. Grainy, some bitter hops. Body thinnish. Quite a nice grainy body, soft light grains. Some vegetal aspects to the aroma later. Perfectly adequate light session bitter, but too unexciting for me.

Cask conditioned at Merton Winter Beer Fest  13. Gold with white head. Drinking this you would never put the ABV at 3.6%. Really good depth to the malts, biscuity, crisp then lemony, citrus hops. There is a general light sweetness smoothing everything out. Just an excellent beer.

Cask at The Rake, quite small creamy head, clear gold yellow colour, aroma of tropical fruits and herbs with a touch of malt in the back, flavour is a melange of white and tropical fruits, with some flowers, strong mellow bitterness, medium pleasant bitter sour aftertaste. Being pale and hoppy is a great combination.

Gravity dispense at the 23rd Battersea Beer Festival - 06/02/13.
Clear pale blonde with a thin white head that clears to the edge and leaves a film.
Nose is floral hops, grass, pale malt, citrus.
Taste comprises hops, grass, lemon, light residual sugars, touch of caramel, mineral tones.
Medium in body with moderate carbonation lending towards a dry finish.
Decent flavoursome low ABV fayre !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Cask Ale tasted at Gallows Bird RAF. Fresh lemoney nose. Pale head. Pale clear golden color. Slightly lemoney malty and hoppy taste. Nice beer. At the end hoppy bitterness.

AROMA: nuts, bread, 
APPEARANCE: golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, 
TASTE: lightly bitter, light sweetness, 
PALATE: light body, thin feel, soft carbonation,
OVERALL: Ok for the low ABV, bit too thin, nice malty aromas.

Hazy hay yellow, white head. Aroma has really clear andc intense hoppiness with grapefruit, citrus and fresh piney soap. Flavour is dry and harsh malty with high bitterness as grapefruity hops. Leaves quite long aftertaste. Superb session beer.
Battersea beer festival 06/02/2013. Clear yellow straw colour. Thin white head. Very spicy caraway aroma. Hop forward.  Crisp mineral palate. Spicy hop finish. Dry finish.

500ml bottle. Pours very cloudy amber with a small head that reduces quickly. Good hoppy aroma. Some mild tropical fruit flavours quickly buried under mountains of bitter hops and intense grapefruit. An exceptionally long bitter finish. Refreshing and satisfying. Love it.

Cask at Gallows Bird real ale festival. Pale golden in color with thin bubbly head. Grassy bitterness with notes of bloodorange in aroma. A bit dry somehow but with some feeling of fresh cut grass and that grassy bitterness nonetheless. Grassy and slightly woody aftertaste.

Cask @ Gallows bird, real ale festival. Clear golden, thin head. Looking great. Lovely hoppy grapefruity aroma, some herbal notes. Flavor has fruity hoppyness, very bitter, grapefruit. Wow. This. Is. Good.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2015 Bottle from Marks and Spencer, Enniskillen [290415]
Light blonde, slight haze, almost no head, rim of bubbles
Aroma - Pungent citrus zest, grapefruit zest, lemon, no malt
Taste of bitter citrus zest, grapefruit zest, lemon, very light pale malts, lots of flavour for the abv, its all about the hops here
Palate - Soft carb, light body, slightly oily, light soft sweet pale malts, bitter zest. Finish - Very bitter grapefruit zest linger
Overall - Robust flavour for the abv. Decent. 3.7 (no change)

Cask @ Bow [230113]. 7/4/8/3/15 Pale straw, slight haze, dense thin white head. Nose of fruity fresh zesty hops, nice soft grapefruit. Taste of fairly sweet grapefruit, soft bitter zesty citrus, touch of grassy hops with a background of light sweet pale malt, very good flavour for the abv. Light body but has some oilyness. Good bitter hop finish with a fairly long linger. Great beer for the abv.

Cask at the Gallows Bird XVI Real Ale Festival, Espoo, Finland. 
Clear pale golden colour with small white head.
Subtle floral hoppiness and some sweetness in aroma. 
Flavour is floral and fruity hoppy with decent bitterness. Very tasty for a 3.6%. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Un incredibile aroma erbaceo sorprende fin da subito. Il colore e di un biondo pallido, la schiuma e bella compatta ma non persistente. Il sapore e particolarissimo: erbaceo con note di...basilico! Complessivamente una buonissima birra.

Ottima pale ale non bella da vedere, bionda sporca, poca schiuma, ottimo aroma frutti gialli e soprattutto ottimo gusto agrumato leggermente speziato e erbaceo amaro soprattutto ne finale! Grande birrificio!

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2013 Dry pale yellow, porous white head. Soft grassy nose. Pitter patter mouthfeel, tickly lime and a bitter the trickle to the finish. Cask, Vintage, Leith
Taste 7>8; Palate 3>4; Overall 13>14
Slight balsamy nose, very light yellow body and a slight white head. Sharp lychee pang on the initial taste and a fairly watery, but bitter palate with embers of malt on the finish. Super sessionable. 
Cask @ Stockbridge Tap, Edinburgh 3.4

(Cask at Southampton Arms, Kentish Town, London, 21 Nov 2012) Pale golden colour with brief creamy white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of citrus, grapefruit, lemon peel and a touch of resin. Fruity, hoppy taste with citrus, grapefruit, lemon, biscuits and a generous fresh bitterness in the finish. Light body, quite dry. Tasty and nice with a generous hop presence.

Bottle @ Yespr tasting. Clear yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and mdoerate hoppy - grass and citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 221012
Cask-conditioned at the Three Tuns, Bristol 12/10/2012. Golden with a slight white head. Aroma of citrus fruit, hay and grassy hops. Flavour of cereal malts, more fruits and a dryish finish. Fine.

Bottle at yespr.
Hazy yellow coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, grass and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops and pine needles with notes of grass.
Dry hoppy finish.

Bottled. Pale yellow coloured. Unclear. Dense light beige head. Aroma: Flowers, sweetness, tropicl fruits, citrus, light pine. Flavour: Citrus, herbs, flowers, sweetness. Medium bodied. Ends floral bitter and grapy. Nice.

cloudy pale yellow, smooth white head.
mild aroma, slighly uk hoppy. flavor is mild, faint grapefruit peel, faint hoppy herbal flavor.

Bottled. A hazy light yellow beer with a huge off-white head. The aroma has notes of lemons, straw, and a bit of malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, lemons, and straw, leading to a bitter lemony finish.
50 cL bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is citrusy and crisp hoppy. Fruity, bitter and light citrusy. Crisp hoppy and light bitter. Fruity and citrusy finish.
Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of yespr/madsberg/Ungstrup. Pours an almost clear pale yellow with a lacing white head. Dry, fresh hoppy aroma. Light body, dry fruitiness with a fresh, bitter finish. 221012
500ml bottle Cotteridge Wines B30. An impressive beer for its low gravity.  Very pale yellow colour.Citrus hop, slightly perfumed finish. A well made beer.
Bottle at eikan pub. Hazy lemon yellow color with white head. Amazing hoppy aroma with fruits. Hoppy, fruity and very good taste. Like this one!

Bottle. Hazy yellow color with medium sized white head. Citrusy aroma with notes of lemon, grapefruit and some malt. Flavor is quite bitter and dry with citrus and grapefruit. Light body, dry and bitter aftertaste. Balanced and tasty.
Cask at Cask Pub and Kitchen, Pimlico, London. A light golden coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy fruity aroma. Tastes hoppy, grapefruit, bitter. Not Buxtons best offering IMO.
Bottle at home 23rd September 2012. Pouts clear, quite fizzy, limited aroma some malt, flavour is weak, least favourite from Buxton
chiara schiuma media piuttosto persitenten citrica discreto agrumato non molto corpo buon amaro piuttosto pungente
23rd July 2012On tap at Craft.  Clear light gold beer, decent white head. Light dry palate. Mild pale malt and a little apple and mild sourness. Hops are super mild citrus. Smooth finish. Okay.

A slightly cloudy, light yellow beer with a medium and white head. Aroma is tastefull, grapefruits, tropical fruits, peaches, some pine needles, overally aroma is almost only hoppy, but that suits for me.Taste is plesant and bitter, biscuity malts, some grapefruits and lots of pine needles. Long, dry and biscuity aftertaste with slightly musty, but that isnt bother too much. Fresh, ligh and nice to drink, low alc.%, but that cant be noticed. Great beer, lot of balanced and aromatic hops with succesfull, dry and light body!

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate malty and dryish aroma, some tropical fruitiness, some grapefruit - piney hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and dryish flavor, light tropical fruitiness, lots of grapefruit - piney hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty and dry, faint fruitiness, lots of grapefruit - piney hoppyness. Excellent dry and well hopped 3,6% golden ale.
Cask. Straw with white head. Light fruits, biscuit, butter, banana, peach, lemon. Love the American Chinook hops.
Pours cloudy golden with a high head. Aroma is malts and fruits. Slightly thin flavor is malts, fruits and lots of hops. Quite full and well balanced considering the ABV.

50 cl bottle.
Pours pale clear golden color with a medium frothy head. Aroma of grassy hops, pale malts, orange peel, mild citrus fruits and some floral notes. Flavor of grass, mild hops, lemon, grape fruits and some grape fruit. Bitter fruity palate, medium carbonation, dry bitter finish. Very refreshing and nicely balanced brew.
3425

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 06/2013
Aroma has lots of exotic fruits, some biscuits and hints of hay. Flavour is somewhat hoppy with exotic fruits, peach and some hay. Quite fruity for a golden ale. And quite good for this ABV.

Cask, half at JDWs Waterhouse in Manchester. Clear golden body and low white head in appearance. Leafy hops to the nose. Fresh fruity taste of lemon and grapefruits. Dry bitter end. Refreshing and easy to drink (08.07.2012).

Cask conditioned	handpump	Craft Beer Co	London	23/07/12.  A blonde beer with a white head.  Lovely sharp grapefruit hoppiness in this, both in the nose and the mouth.  Very citrussy and no sweetness at all from the malts.  A little floral perfumed note in the mouth.  Really lush.  POssibly the best Chinooky beer Ive had.8

Cask at Kittys, Helsinki.  Hazy golden. Aroma of kiwi fruits and mango. Mid dry with light body and soft, firm mouthfeel. Lovely elegant light malt profile that hides under a wealth of tropical fruit hops. Long bitter finish. Hugely drinkable hoppy light ale.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */s
Clear golden-yellow color, small white head. Flowery hops, wet doggie in the nose.Light-bodied. Pale malty, crackers, light hoppyness. Very balanced and tasty light ale.

Cask @ Kittys, Helsinki.
Pours a clear yellow colour without a head. Aroma of grass, citrus and pale malts. Flavour of pale malts, citrus, grass, strong citrusy hops and some caramel. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a grassy, citrusy, bitter finish. Very refreshing. Good.

(Cask at Kittys, 20120725) The beer poured pale golden and clear. Its head was small, sparse and white. Aroma had citricness, tangerine, general fruitiness and mildly malts. Palate was medium bodied with almost medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, citricness, grass, malts and quite intense bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy and bitter. A very tasty brew with a bit poor looks.

Cask @ Gallows Bird, Espoo. Light yellow with a foamy, white head. Floral, fuity, mainly citric, aroma with a hint of grain and grass. Clear flavour with the very same elements as in the aroma. A malty, fruity finish.

Cask @ Kittys, Helsinki

Pours clear light yellow with a smooth foamy head. Aroma of citrusy hops, lemon and grapefruit. Taste is light and refreshing with some citrusy and grassy hops and some malts. Finish is a bit watery, quite fruity and slightly malty with some lingering bitter hops. Nice, easy going but tasty session beer.
50cl, new English brew Anno 2010, from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, not complex bitter brew, malty/bitter and slightly fruity, refreshing, balanced, cloudy, rocky head, nice brew
Cask at bow ... golden yellow ... soft floral zezt ... dry lemon zezty ... soft fruits ... light lemon bitter linger

50cl bottle @ home. Lightly unclear yellow golden color, full sized rough white head that leaves a good lacing. Smell malts, hops, slightly perfume. Taste malts, hops, bitter and lightly citrussy. Extremely fresh and easy drinkable. I wouldnt mind having this all night. Medium carbonation, medium body. Very enjoyable.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Festival 2012. Yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is fruity, floral and also has some grassy and leathery notes. Flavour is quite similar. Balanced and so, but a bit dull as well.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity dusty hoppy aroma. Fruity malty dry hoppy flavor with hints of citrus. Has a fruity malty hoppy finish.

[cask at the Stockbridge Tap, Edinburgh] Very pale yellow beer, nice white head. Soft, vinous aroma  Id have sworn this was Nelson Sauvin instead of Chinook. Grapey citric flavour, some lemon and lime fruit  really easy to drink, very refreshing bitterness. Another winner  and at only 3.6 a real cracker [06062012]
Delicious refreshing hoppy citrus aroma and flavour. Lovely stuff and a low abv

Cask at The Grove, Huddersfield. It pours straw yellow, with a thick white head. The nose is mango, peach, straw and pine. The taste is zesty lemon, soap, peach, grapefruit, straw, pine, resin and grass, with a bitter-dry finish. Light body and soft carbonation. A full flavour low ABV ale.

50cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Slightly hazy pale golden colour, white head. Aroma of loads of citrus, grapefruits, grapes, lime, but also a bit of the famous "Burton snatch" in there (something eggy/sulphur). Flavour is light sweet, lots of sharp citrus, grapefruit bitterness, lime, lemon, hint of floral sweetness, rather bitter drying finish. When the beer warms up some grainy flavours emerge. Light bodied, but never watery. Very nice summer beer.
Half Pint at Reading Beer Festival 2012.  Light, citrus and fresh aroma. Tastes of citrus and a little more, light and fruity.  Golden, with almost no head.

A - citrus and floral
A - golden with lacy head
T - light sweet full bitter
P -mid and soft
O - good

Hoppy aroma and taste, not very fruity. Ok body for a 3.6% beer. Very dry and bitter. Tasty for a low-alcohol beer. Bit low on body of course and bit too dry/bitter for my taste.
Bottle at monthly tasting @ de Molen, hosted by dEnk. Clear golden pour, huge foamy white head. Aroma of hops, fruity, citrus, air freshner. Flavor is quite bitter, light and well drinkable.

Bottle at Evening Star Brighton. Clear pale gold with thick lasting white head. Fresh hoppy aroma. Light tangerine aroma. Yep lovely tasty zesty zippy bright golden ale with plenty of hops. I bet on cask in good nick this would be outstanding. Still pretty damn good

Yellow haze and a bubbly, rocky head. Fresh hoppy, grass and fresh yeast. Light body, but at such a low abv this is expected and actually fairly rich. Refreshing. Very dry but pretty flavourful. Nice. (At the De Molen tasting)
Aroma is big fruity hops, slight malt note. Flavour is huge hop, very dry and fruity. Very nice.
Cask. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. MOderate malty and heavy hopy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Golden/straw colored pour. Big white head and lacing rings as I drink. Big hop aroma with some malts backing it up. Big hop bite up front with some bitterness and malty goodness. Nice, crisp finish. Very nice beer.
Tap @ Euston Tap. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are fruits, flowers, malt and hops. Medium bodied and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a hazy light orange, aroma smacks of grapefruit and lime zest, with a slight hint of caramel. Flavour is more grapefruit, citrus pith, soft light mouthfeel and a long drying pithy bitter finish. Quality brew. Would be excellent on cask I bet

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2015 Cask at Southampton Arms. Pale blond colour with white bubbly head. Aroma is grassy hops, bit of citrus. Taste is quite grainy, bit of cream and the expected lemony bitterness. Not bad. Rerate at Euston Tap, Jan. 2015. Pale blond. Very wheaty, lots of grain. Soft and malty. Light fruity hoppiness and finished with a little citrus bitterness. Nice. Seems from my scores I am a bit more generous now.
Bottle from Great Grog. Cloudy pale yellow colour, reasonable head. Biscuit & tropical fruit aroma. Biscuit, citrus fruit & lemon flavour. Bitter aftertaste. Good light refreshing blond beer.

Bottle @ home. Pours a light golden color. Light, airy white head. The nose is of citrus, grass, some dirt, ginger. The taste is lightly sweet, some tropical citrus fruits, a tiny bit of barnyard. The finish is crisp, dry and nicely medium bitter. Light body, medium carbonation. This is a really pleasing, summery beer thats easy to drink. Would be good with sushi Id imagine. Great flavor out of only 3.6%, mind. Top work from Buxton.

From bottle. Very pale with white head. Fairly hoppy aroma, mostly citrus with a little spiciness, peppery, little piny resin. Similar taste but with a yeasty finish. Light and refreshing on the palate. Good for its abv, let down slightly by yeast flavor.

amazing amount of flavour for its meagre alcohol.  very heady aroma of grapefruit and citrus hops. a faint hint of crushed strawberry too!
taste is much more subtle but equally impressive. all of the above with a touch of pine resin thrown in too.  lovely carbonation and a gentle bitter finish.
show me the beer garden!
(bottle. beerritz, leeds)
Cask at Craft Beer CO, London. Pale golden beer with a offwhite head. Hoppy, fruity aroma. Fruity, hoppy flavour with a strange taste of cardboard. Thin and not a nice beer at all...

Cask at Craft Beer, London. Golden beer, bubbly head. Soapy aroma, hoppy, some citrus. Fruity, hoppy flavor, citrus, spicy notes, some cardboard notes. Im afraid I cant join the fanclub for this beer.
Grassy hops in aroma and mouthful, excellent citrus balance, extremely drinkable. Great hop character, magnificent example of the style.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2012 Cask at CBC, London. Pours clear yellow with a foamy, white head. Straw hop nose. Light to medium sweet flavor, dry straw, light dough. Light to medium in body with fine carbonation. Good condition. Dry finish, some delicate grass and straw, mild white bread. Good stuff, but not outstanding like most of the Buxton lineup. (3.7)Cask at the Euston Tap, London. Pours clear gold with a fine, white foam head. Dry grass and straw nose. Light sweet flavor with strong bitterness, some dry grass, hay, dry biscuits. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Good condition. Sticky and dry hops to finish with lots of grass and straw, light sweetness. Quite crisp on the finish. A very well hopped beer that packs a lot of flavor punch for a low ABVer. (3.8)
Bottle. Very hoppy, citric nose with the flavour to compliment it. Held its head well and had a great grapefruit aftertaste. Definately one for the summer months, but a smashing session beer
Bottle from beer ritz. Pale blonde with subtle aroma of pineapple and yeast. Initial fresh bitterness becomes lemon and Passion fruit in the finish.
Hand pulled at the Wellington, Birmingham. Golden, thin head. Smells good to me. Fresh grassy hops in the fresh, alpine mouthfeel. Some late tropical fruit too. Very good.

Bottle from Great Grog. Pale amber pour, thick white head slowly recedes. Juicy tropical fruit nose - mango, passion fruit? Dry body, maybe bready malts. Hints of citrus fruits with a refreshing bitter linger. Light n easy, I like it.

In bottle from Great Grog. Poured a blonde colour with a thick head. Juicy passion fruit, mango and grapefruit nose. Similar juicy hop flavours. Nicely bitter with a caramel malt backbone. Moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. A nice bitter - dry finish. Very good, especially given the 3.6% abv.
Another superb beer from Buxton. Grapefruity, plenty of citrus otherwise with the grapefruit prominent in a long bitter finish.
user_location: Chapel en le Frith, Derbyshire, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: NOV 25, 2011 1) Cask handpull, The Stable Bar, Monsal Head Hotel, Monsal Head, Derbyshire. Resolving straw thick and milky with condition. Delicate lemony, wood sap, fresh hop aroma like the sticky dried hopcone Octo just found in the hedgerow, but with fresh lychee hints as the head subsides. Deep stewed spicy hop tea flavour with a lingering smoked creaminess. Hints of celery and bacon. Complex malt and hops, perfectly dovetailed. Beautiful. 848416=4. 
2) Hand-pulled by myself, Wolvey village hall, Wolvey- the afternoon after my wedding reception. And at least a gallon the night before. Different beer to in Derbyshire..even better. Aroma of pineapple jelly and cream, satsumas, lightly mouldy, grapefuit and lemonade. Pungent, resinous, almost shocking marmalade and tonic bitterness softening into satsuma and rich tea biscuit. Utterly brilliant pale gold soaked with condition and lace. Packed with hops and malt, character and sessionabilty. For me everything thats pure, sociable and beautiful about English beer compressed into a pint glass. Got me through the most stressful and emotional 15mins of my life- my grooms speech. Cheers Buxton.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2013 Cask at the Southampton Arms, London on 16th June 2011. Gold with lasting white lacing head. Hoppy, fruity aroma with malt notes, floral and grapefruit hoppiness in-mouth and a smoky kick. Grapefruit citrus aftertaste. RE-RATING 3RD JANUARY 2013. Bottle at home, Christmas gift. Pours clear gold with off-white head and lasting lace. Grapefruit hoppy aroma. Rich grass and grapefruit in-mouth, and an increasingly bitter finish. Zingy mouthfeel and light to medium body. Beautifully crafted,
500ml bottle.  Pours light lemon gold with a large, tight head.  Aroma is faint, light grass and juicy lemon and lime.  Taste has some straw to start.Light grapefruit bitter hop finish.

Cask at The Thorn Tree, nr Ripley, Derbyshire, 08-07-10   Pours light gold with a thin white rim of bubbles. Mmmhh this is nice and citric, refreshing and clean tasting, lemon and grapefruit on nose and in mouth, dry finish, really decent for the abv.   A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6

Cask Stillage at Edgeley Park, Stockport 04/06/2010
Fruity hop aroma. Clear golden coloured pale and hoppy with a grapefruit flavour. A little creamy on the palate with a dry and bitter lasting floral finish.
